business.headline: FII selling back to haunt Dalal Street? What investors need to knowSeveral global triggers are behind Dalal Street's recent correction, including the downgrade of US sovereign credit, a rise in US and Japanese bond yields, a spike in Covid cases, and geopolitical chatter about a possible Israeli strike on Iran.
Sensex, Nifty rebound with gains led by pharma; market faces FII pressureThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 116.72 points to 81,303.16, while the NSE Nifty gained 18 points to 24,701.90 as of 9:25 am.

Belrise Industries IPO: Should you subscribe or skip? GMP shows listing gainBelrise Industries IPO will remain open for bidding for three days and will close on Friday, May 23, 2025. The price band for the IPO has been fixed at Rs 85 to Rs 90 per share.

Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher today. Check key levels, trading strategyBoth the Nifty50 and the BSE Sensex ended lower in the last session as foreign portfolio investors sold shares worth Rs 10,016.10 crore, according to provisional data. This was the highest single-day outflow since February 28.

Stocks to watch today on May 21: ONGC, IndiGo, RVNL, IndusInd Bank, SBIAmong the companies that will report their financial results today are Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC), IndusInd Bank, InterGlobe Aviation (which operates IndiGo), Colgate-Palmolive (India), NTPC Green Energy, etc.

Elon Musk vows to retain Tesla CEO post for next 5 years: No doubt about thatMusk made a video appearance at the Qatar Economic Forum hosted by Bloomberg after he recently travelled to Doha as part of Donald Trump's Mideast trip last week.

ITR-1 Sahaj vs ITR-4 Sugam: Which ITR form should you use?ITR-1 is for straightforward income from salary or pension, while ITR-4 is suitable if you're into small business or freelance work and are using the presumptive taxation scheme.

Sensex closes 873 points lower, Nifty falls below 25,000; Eternal down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 872.98 points to end at 81,186.44, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 261.55 points to close at 24,683.90.

What is ITR-U? Check who can file, penalties, and last dateIf you missed filing your return on time or made a mistake in your previous ITR, the ITR-U gives you another chance to set things right—this time with more time on your hands.

South India emerges as top choice for GCC offices in early 2025With Bengaluru, Chennai, and Hyderabad collectively securing a dominant 64% share of all GCC office leasing in Q1 2025, the southern region has firmly established itself as the preferred destination for global corporations setting up specialised capability centres in India.

Mutual fund boom in India: Guess what's fuelling the Rs 65 lakh crore surgeMumbai alone leads the chart, contributing 27% (Rs 17.75 lakh crore), followed by Delhi at 12.63%, Bengaluru at 5.39%, Pune at 4%, and Kolkata at 3.49%. These numbers haven't changed much since last year, according to data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

Explained: Why Sensex tanked nearly 900 points todayAt today's closing, the Sensex had plunged 872.98 points to settle at 81,186.44, while the Nifty 50 fell 261.55 points to end at 24,683.90. All major sectoral indices closed in the red, with Auto, Media, Financial Services, and Healthcare stocks among the worst hit.

entertainment.headline: Ishaan Khatter, Neeraj Ghaywan help Janhvi like true gentlemen at Cannes. WatchIshaan Khatter and 'Homebound' director Neeraj Ghaywan helped Janhvi Kapoor with her gown at Cannes 2025. Videos of their sweet gestures have caught the attention of all.

AR Rahman reacts to his 'Periya Bhai' nicknameOscar award-winning composer AR Rahman's reaction to his 'Periya Bhai' nickname went viral on social media. Among Tamils, he is fondly called Periya Bhai.

Rahul Vaidya defends himself, says 'people took joke on Virat Kohli wrongly'Singer Rahul Vaidya recently addressed his tiff with Virat Kohli after the cricketer blocked and unblocked him on Instagram. Vaidya mentioned how people took his joke in the wrong direction and sensationalised it.

Kamal Haasan opts 8-week OTT window for Thug Life: Hope others followKamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's much-awaited film, 'Thug Life', will start streaming on OTT eight weeks after its theatrical run. At the Mumbai event, Haasan said it was a pragmatic decision.

Janhvi Kapoor stuns in pink couture from Banaras on Cannes red carpet. PicsJanhvi Kapoor made her red carpet debut at Cannes on Tuesday in Tarun Tahiliani's couture. Her blush pink outfit was handcrafted from Banaras.

IT Welcome to Derry trailer: Fear of Pennywise strikes backThe horror of Pennywise, the dancing clown, once again strikes back with the disappearance of kids in the trailer of the upcoming miniseries IT - Welcome to Derry.

Saiyami Kher recalls facing casting couch at 19: Was asked to make compromisesActor Saiyami Kher recalled when a female casting director asked her to compromise for a role. She faced the casting couch incident when she was 19-year-old.
Priyadarshan reacts to Paresh Rawal's exit from Hera Pheri 3: I am hurtDirector Priyadarshan has expressed deep disappointment over Paresh Rawal's sudden exit from 'Hera Pheri 3', calling it hurtful.

Karan Johar calls Hrithik, Jr NTR's War 2 epic: How hot Kiara is lookingFilmmaker Karan Johar called Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's War 2 'blockbuster of the year.' He also praised Kiara Advani's look from the film.

Archana Puran Singh reacts to marital trouble rumours with Parmeet SethiArchana Puran Singh has put an end to rumours about marital issues with husband Parmeet Sethi, clarifying in a recent vlog that their playful banter is often mistaken for tension.

How Katy Perry managed to avoid a wardrobe malfunction during Las Vegas showKaty Perry gracefully managed a mid-show wardrobe slip during her Las Vegas concert, continuing her performance without missing a beat. The singer is currently on tour for her seventh studio album, 143.
Aishwarya Rai arrives in Cannes with daughter Aaradhya. WatchAishwarya Rai Bachchan has arrived at the Cannes Film Festival 2025 alongside her daughter Aaradhya.

Actor Vishal Jethwa travels to Cannes with his mother, shares adorable picsActor Vishal Jethwa fulfilled his childhood dream by taking his mother to Cannes, where his film 'Homebound' will premiere on May 21. He shared photos with a heartfelt note, expressing gratitude to his fans for their support.

Mukesh Khanna returns as Shaktimaan: Thrilled to connect with today's youthMukesh Khanna is returning as India's first superhero Shaktimaan. The actor expressed excitement about connecting with a whole new generation.

Raashii Khanna teases intense new role with bruised BTS picsRaashii Khanna shared bruised behind-the-scenes photos from her upcoming project, hinting at an intense and physically demanding role. While she didn't reveal the title, fans suspect she is shooting for 'Farzi 2'.

Satyajit Ray film institute student at Cannes La Cinef: Want to be voice for AfricansEthiopian filmmaker Kokob Gebrehaweria's no-budget film featuring a Nigerian footballer has been selected for Cannes La Cinef 2025. The film sheds light on the exploitation faced by African footballers in India and aims to give them a strong voice through cinema.

Mohanlal gets sweet tribute as Kerala artist creates his jackfruit portrait. WatchAhead of Mohanlal's birthday, a Kerala-based artist created a portrait of the actor using jackfruits. It took five hours and 20 jackfruits to create the art.

It's a crisis: Suniel Shetty on Paresh Rawal's shock exit from Hera Pheri 3Actor Suniel Shetty, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, said that the sudden announcement of Paresh Rawal's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3' was shocking, calling it a "big crisis".

Kiara Advani lists her firsts from War 2: First action film, first bikini shotActor Kiara Advani listed her 'lots of firsts' from Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR-starrer 'War 2.' This is the first time she has collaborated with filmmaker Ayan Mukerji for an action film.

general news.headline: Delegations briefed on India's 'new normal' as Op Sindoor outreach starts todayForeign Secretary Vikram Misri briefed Members of Parliament who are part of delegations visiting various countries as part of India's Operation Sindoor global outreach.

India's Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize for 'Heart Lamp'Indian author Banu Mushtaq and translator Deepa Bhasthi have won the International Booker Prize for fiction for "Heart Lamp," a collection of 12 short stories.

Lashkar co-founder Amir Hamza critically injured, hospitalised in LahoreTerror group Lashkar-e-Taiba's co-founder, Amir Hamza, was injured in an accident at his home and has been hospitalised in Lahore.

Trump unveils $175-billion 'Golden Dome' defence plan to counter China, RussiaUS President Donald Trump has announced a $175 billion missile defence plan, the Golden Dome. It will use satellites to track and stop missiles from threats like China and Russia. The system also targets new dangers like AI drones and hypersonic weapons.

Post-Op Sindoor, Indian security needs to look eastAs Pakistan's military establishment licks its wounds after Operation Sindoor, it will look for spots far from Kashmir to foment trouble so that no smoking gun leads to it. There are reasons galore that India's security establishment should be keeping a hawk-eyed watch on its eastern borders.

US intel indicates possible Israeli attack on Iranian nuclear facilities: ReportThe US intelligence suggests Israel may be preparing to strike Iran's nuclear facilities, CNN reported. While no final decision is confirmed, rising tensions, stalled US-Iran talks, and Iran's weakened state have raised fears of potential conflict.

BJP shares Rahul Gandhi-Asim Munir poster, Congress retorts with PM-Sharif picIn a latest poster war, the BJP linked Rahul Gandhi with Pak army chief Asim Munir, while Congress linked PM Modi with Pak ex-PM Nawaz Sharif.

Tamil Nadu moves Supreme Court against Centre for withholding education fundsTamil Nadu in its petition to the Supreme Court accused the Central government of financial coercion. Tamil Nadu said the Center was forcing the state to impose NEP, and sought judicial intervention to protect federalism and education rights.

Janhvi Kapoor stuns in pink couture from Banaras on Cannes red carpet. PicsJanhvi Kapoor made her red carpet debut at Cannes on Tuesday in Tarun Tahiliani's couture. Her blush pink outfit was handcrafted from Banaras.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Army denies deploying air defence guns at Golden Temple during Op SindoorThe Indian Army denied deploying air defence systems inside the Golden Temple in Punjab's Amritsar after reports claimed rare coordination with shrine authorities.

Cops inactive and absent, Trinamool leader involved: Murshidabad violence reportA three-member fact-finding committee submitted its report to Calcutta High Court on Tuesday. The report highlights the absence and inactivity of the police during the incident.

Gen Bold start, Gen Gold finish: Suryavanshi signs off IPL in style14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi capped off his IPL 2025 debut season with a composed 57 off 33 balls. Ending with 252 runs at a strike rate of 206.56, Vaibhav showcased maturity beyond his years.

Never found her suspicious: Bengal YouTuber recalls meeting 'spy' Jyoti MalhotraKolkata-based Youtuber Soumit Bhattacharya met Jyoti Malhotra, who had been arrested on serious charges of espionage for Pakistan, three times in the last one-and-a-half years.

Indian-origin techie killed in Texas by fellow Indian passenger on moving busIndian entrepreneur Akshay Gupta was fatally stabbed on an Austin bus by fellow Indian national Deepak Kandel, who confessed, claiming Gupta "looked like his uncle." Kandel faces first-degree murder charges.

Hoarding collapses, subway flooded as sudden rain lashes Mumbai, nearby areasAccording to the meteorological department, rainfall activity across Maharashtra is expected to intensify between May 21 and May 24 due to the impact of a cyclonic circulation.

Rahul Vaidya defends himself, says 'people took joke on Virat Kohli wrongly'Singer Rahul Vaidya recently addressed his tiff with Virat Kohli after the cricketer blocked and unblocked him on Instagram. Vaidya mentioned how people took his joke in the wrong direction and sensationalised it.

Munir's magic: Lose a war, get a promotionThe promotion of Pakistani army chief Asim Munir to Field Marshal has been packaged as a reward for his so-called military success against India. However, it is more a desperate attempt to mask the failure of his Operation Bunyan al-Marsoos. Munir's elevation cements his control, not credibility.

'No permission needed': Iran's supreme leader Khamenei slams US nuclear demandsIran's Supreme Leader Khamenei dismissed US objections to uranium enrichment, stating Iran needs no permission. Amid stalled indirect talks, officials cite American inconsistency as a barrier to nuclear negotiation progress.
Indian Army helps repair mosque damaged in Pak shelling in J&K villageThe Indian Army carried out repair work on the mosque which was damaged in shelling by Pakistan.

Why Yunus govt, Bangladesh Islamists can't kill Awami LeagueThe Awami League, banned by Muhammad Yunus' interim government, isn't a political party but a cult. Outlawed thrice in the past, the party sprang back to life each time, and commands a 40% vote share. It is the inheritor of Mujibur Rahman's legacy, whose life is integral to Bangladesh's freedom struggle, and Bengali nationalism. This is why Islamists or Yunus won't be able to sink the AL boat.

I've done enough: Elon Musk pulls plug on political spending after backing TrumpElon Musk, after spending nearly USD 300 million backing Trump in 2024, says he'll drastically reduce political donations, citing burnout and business focus: "I think I've done enough."

Indian astronaut to conduct 5 experiments with Nasa, speak to studentsThe announcement comes as the Axiom crew completes its ISS training and prepares for launch, with a flight readiness review scheduled for Wednesday.

Between Pahalgam & Op Sindoor: A communication warFormer diplomats believe India's absence from foreign media platforms and lack of communication activities by embassies and high commissions between April 22 and May 7 left space open for the Pakistani narrative to spread unchecked.

sports.headline: Mumbai weather report: Who qualifies for playoffs if MI vs DC gets washed out?As the IPL playoffs race tightens, the weather in Mumbai could play a decisive role in shaping the final standings. With just one point separating MI and DC, it might turn out to be a frustrating waiting game for both teams.

Anshul Kamboj will be a handful in India A's tour of England: FlemingIPL 2025: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming said that Anshul Kamboj will be effective when India A tour England for two first-class matches later this year. In the ongoing Indian Premier League season, Kamboj has taken five wickets from seven matches at an economy rate of 8.36.

MS Dhoni should walk away if he can't do it: Kris SrikkanthIPL 2025: Former cricketer Kris Srikkanth said that CSK skipper MS Dhoni has struggled as his reflexes have gone down and age has also taken a toll on his fitness levels.

Matheesha Pathirana has to drill down on what he needs to do: FlemingIPL 2025: Head coach Stephen Fleming talked about Matheesha Pathirana's poor run of form where he has bowled at an economy rate of 10.17, despite having taken 12 wickets from 11 games.

Gen Bold start, Gen Gold finish: Suryavanshi signs off IPL in style14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi capped off his IPL 2025 debut season with a composed 57 off 33 balls. Ending with 252 runs at a strike rate of 206.56, Vaibhav showcased maturity beyond his years.

Will miss Mitchell Starc on the bouncy surface of Wankhede: DC coach Munaf PatelDelhi Capitals (DC) bowling coach Munaf Patel has admitted that the team will miss the veteran speedster Mitchell Starc on the bouncy surface at the Wankhede Stadium in their all-important fixture against Mumbai Indians (MI).

MS Dhoni's advice for Vaibhav Suryavanshi: Don't take pressure, when expectations riseChennai Super Kings (CSK) stand-in captain MS Dhoni came up with some advice for young batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi saying that the he shouldn't take pressure as the expectations rise and should work on consistency.

Sanju Samson delighted with acing the chase after making brave call at the tossRajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson was elated after his team's successful run chase against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Match 62 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Vaibhav Suryavanshi bows down to Dhoni, signs off IPL with blessingsVaibhav Suryavanshi played a mature innings to help Rajasthan Royals chase down 188 against Chennai Super Kings. His gesture of seeking MS Dhoni's blessings highlighted respect and his upbringing.

Suryavanshi, Samson end Royals' campaign on triumphant note as CSK hit new lowRajasthan Royals (RR) beat Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by 6 wickets in Match 62 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) at Arun Jaitley Stadium, Delhi. Vaibhav Suryavanshi once again starred with a magnificent innings of 57 (33).

Dale Steyn slams CSK for bizarre batting tactics: 3 down and they send 2 bowlersLegendary South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn slammed Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for promoting Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja in the batting order after their collapse in the powerplay.

MS Dhoni's advice for Vaibhav Suryavanshi: Don't take pressure, when expectations riseChennai Super Kings (CSK) stand-in captain MS Dhoni came up with some advice for young batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi saying that the he shouldn't take pressure as the expectations rise and should work on consistency.

Suryavanshi, Samson end Royals' campaign on triumphant note as CSK hit new lowRajasthan Royals (RR) beat Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by 6 wickets in Match 62 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) at Arun Jaitley Stadium, Delhi. Vaibhav Suryavanshi once again starred with a magnificent innings of 57 (33).

Dale Steyn slams CSK for bizarre batting tactics: 3 down and they send 2 bowlersLegendary South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn slammed Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for promoting Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja in the batting order after their collapse in the powerplay.

DC bowling coach Munaf Patel admits being under pressure ahead of must-win fixture vs MIDelhi Capitals (DC) bowling coach Munaf Patel admitted that the team is under pressure ahead of the must-win fixture against Mumbai Indians (MI) in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL2 205). Delhi desperately need to win the upcoming fixture to stay alive in the play-offs race.

Win or lose, it's always a party at DC: Bowling coach Munaf PatelDelhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel has said that win or lose, there is always a party in the team's dressing room. His comments come ahead of a crucial clash against Mumbai Indians, which might decide the playoffs spots this season.

Bumrah should lead India in England, KL Rahul can replace Kohli: MSK PrasadFormer selector MSK Prasad has recommended Jasprit Bumrah as the Indian Test captain. The suggestion includes Shubman Gill as vice-captain and KL Rahul for a key batting role, hinting at team stability and strategic changes for the England tour.

England name playing XI for one-off Test vs Zimbabwe, Sam Cook set to make debutEngland cricket team has named their playing XI for their upcoming one-off Test against Zimbabwe, set to be played from Thursday, May 22 at Trent Bridge, Nottingham.

IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals drop Farooqi for last fixture vs Chennai Super KingsRajasthan Royals (RR) dropped Afghanistan's left-arm seamer Fazalhaq Farooqi for their last fixture against Chennai Super Kings (CSK). They brought in Yudvir Singh to replace him in the playing XI.

CSK vs RR: MS Dhoni says the Chennai rebuild process is already underwayMS Dhoni said that the Chennai Super Kings have already started their rebuilding process for next season. CSK are already out of the tournament and will use the remaining games to get their combination right moving ahead.

Watch: MS Dhoni jumps fence to meet little fan at Arun Jaitley StadiumChennai Super Kings (CSK) wicketkeeper batter MS Dhoni had a heartwarming meet-up with a young fan as he jumped over fence to meet him at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals drop Farooqi for last fixture vs Chennai Super KingsRajasthan Royals (RR) dropped Afghanistan's left-arm seamer Fazalhaq Farooqi for their last fixture against Chennai Super Kings (CSK). They brought in Yudvir Singh to replace him in the playing XI.

CSK vs RR: MS Dhoni says the Chennai rebuild process is already underwayMS Dhoni said that the Chennai Super Kings have already started their rebuilding process for next season. CSK are already out of the tournament and will use the remaining games to get their combination right moving ahead.

Watch: MS Dhoni jumps fence to meet little fan at Arun Jaitley StadiumChennai Super Kings (CSK) wicketkeeper batter MS Dhoni had a heartwarming meet-up with a young fan as he jumped over fence to meet him at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

Manchester United receive triple injury boost ahead of Europa League finalManchester United received a potential triple injury boost ahead of their UEFA Europa League final against Tottenham Hotspur on Wednesday, May 21. Leny Yoro, Joshua Zirkzee and Diogo Dalot took part in the training session before the final.

RCB vs SRH moved out of Bengaluru due to heavy rainfall, Lucknow new venueRCB's final home game against SRH has been moved out of Bengaluru due to the incessant rains in the city. The match on May 23 will now take place in Lucknow.

IPL 2025 final taken out of Kolkata, to be played in AhmedabadThe Indian Premeir League final 2025 final will be played in Ahmedabad, the Indian Cricket Board announced on Tuesday, May 20. Two of the playoffs matches have been shifted to Mullanpur.

De Bruyne coy on playing Club World Cup for Manchester City: Maybe I won't playKevin de Bruyne admitted that he may not play the Club World Cup for Manchester City as he wants to take care of himself. De Bruyne is set to leave City in the summer.

Rishabh Pant needs a break: Kris Srikkanth urges LSG to rest their skipperFormer India cricketer Kris Srikkanth believes Lucknow Super Giants should rest Rishabh Pant for the remainder of IPL 2025, citing the batter's prolonged slump in form and the team's exit from playoff contention.

England coach Brendon McCullum aims for glory in decisive 2025: Time to shoot for starsEngland coach Brendon McCullum wants his side to chase glory with the India series and Ashes on the horizon. England will face India in a five-match Test series, starting from June 20.

CSK have to let go R Ashwin if they are to release funds: MoodyIPL 2025: Tom Moody said that the Chennai Super Kings (CSK) have to let go R Ashwin before the season to free up their purse. CSK bought Ashwin for Rs 9.75 crore in the mega auction last year.

LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka posts heartwarming image with Pant after IPL exitLSG owner Sanjiv Goenka shared a heartwarming image with Rishabh Pant after the team's exit from the IPL 2025. Lucknow were eliminated after their loss to Hyderabad at the Ekana stadium on May 19.

FC Barcelona not looking at Nico Williams in transfer plans: Laporta confirmsBarcelona president Joan Laporta has confirmed that the club is no longer pursuing a move for Athletic Club winger Nico Williams. While the Spaniard was previously on their shortlist, Barcelona are now focusing on other targets ahead of the summer window.

No excuses: Evra sends rallying call to Manchester United before Europa finalPatrice Evra sent a rallying call to the Manchester United players, urging them to give their all in the upcoming Europa League final against Tottenham Hotspur on Wednesday, May 21. Evra said that United will have no excuses during the match in Bilbao.

MS Dhoni nears big six-hitting landmark as CSK look to salvage prideIPL 2025: MS Dhoni is on the cusp of becoming only the fourth Indian in Men's T20s to hit 350 or more sixes. The 42-year-old Dhoni has scored 180 runs from 12 matches in the competition.

Indian selectors undecided about Test captaincy after Gill, Pant talks: ReportAccording to a latest report from Sky Sports, the Indian selection committee is still undecided about whom to name as the new Test captain after holding informal talks with both Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
